TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Euic, isohyperthermic Fluvaquentic Haplohemists

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Manglillo muck--wildlife habitat (Colors are for moist soil).
Oa--0 to 5 inches; black (N 2.5/) muck; massive; very friable; slightly sticky, nonplastic; common medium and coarse roots; strongly effervescent; moderately alkaline; gradual wavy boundary. (1 to 18 inches thick)
Oi--5 to 24 inches; 50 percent dark brown (10YR 3/3) and 50 percent very dark brown (7.5YR 2.5/3) mucky peat, rubbed; about 95 percent fiber material after rubbing; massive; very friable; slightly sticky, nonplastic; common medium and coarse roots; strongly effervescent; moderately alkaline; gradual wavy boundary. (7 to 33 inches thick)
Cg1--24 to 43 inches; dark greenish gray (10Y 3/1) mucky loam, rubbed; about 50 percent fiber material after rubbing; massive; very friable; slightly sticky; nonplastic; strongly effervescent; moderately alkaline; abrupt wavy boundary. (2 to 15 inches thick)
Cg2--43 to 60 inches; 50 percent light greenish gray (10Y 8/1), 25 percent greenish gray (10Y 6/1), and 25 percent greenish gray 5GY 5/1) sandy loam; massive; very friable; nonsticky, nonplastic; about 12 percent gravels; strongly effervescent; moderately alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico. Approximately 3.7 miles southeast of Pole Ojea community, about 1.9 miles south on La Pitahaya road from the intersection of P.R. Hwy. 303, and about 300 feet west of road on wildlife habitat.  USGS Cabo Rojo topographic quadrangle (1966); lat. 17 degrees 57 minutes 07 seconds N.; long. 67 degrees 08 minutes 04 seconds W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Thickness of the organic material range from 18 to 50 inches. Reaction is moderately alkaline throughout.
The Oa horizon has hue of 5Y, value of 2.5, and chroma of 1; or it is neutral with value of 2.5.  Texture is muck.
The Oi horizon has hue 7.5YR or 10YR, value of 2.5 or 3, and chroma of 2 or 3. Fiber content ranges from 75 to over 95 percent after rubbing.  Texture is mucky peat.
The upper part of the Cg horizon has hue of 10Y, value of 3, and chroma of 1. Fiber content ranges from 35 to 50 percent after rubbing.  Texture is mucky loam.
The lower part of the Cg horizon has hue of 10Y to 5GY, value of 5 to 8, and chroma of 1.  Content of pebbles range from 0 to less than 15 percent, by volume.  Texture is sandy loam.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are no known series in the same family.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Manglillo soils are in tidal marshes along the coast of the Semiarid Coastal Plains MLRA. These areas are either under sea water or are flooded by high tides. Slopes range from 0 to 1 percent. They formed in decomposed organic material overlying regolith consisting in sand size shell fragments, quartz grains and subrounded volcanic fragments of recent beach deposits. The climate is tropical semiarid. The average annual precipitation ranges from 28 to 36 inches and the average annual temperature ranges from 82 to 86 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Boqueron and Serrano series.  All of these series are mineral soils.  Boqueron soils are on similar to slightly higher positions.  The poorly drained Serrano soils are on slightly higher positions.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Very poorly drained; rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Most areas of Manglillo soils are used for wildlife habitat. The vegetation consists of Red and White mangrove.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Southern semiarid coastal plains of Puerto Rico. The series is not extensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE:  Raleigh, North Carolina.

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Cabo Rojo Municipality, Puerto Rico; 2007. The name is from Manglillo beach, where it was originally recognized.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS: Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon:
Histic epipedon - the zone from 0 to 24 inches (Oa and Oi horizons).
Gleyed feature - the zone from 24 to 60 inches (Cg1 and Cg2 horizons).
These soils were formerly included in the tidal swamp miscellaneous land type.
Manglillo soils are in MLRA 273.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
